meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Jeanne Douglas Tom Brothers Ron Trigueiro Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #822.

td.p: Jeanne Douglas, a secretary from Los Angeles, California
Tom Brothers, an attorney from Lynnwood, Washington
Ron Trigueiro, a student from Carruthers, California (whose 2-day cash winnings total $28,100)

tr.td: FORMER CAPITALS
CARTOONS
COLLEGES
BEER
BROADWAY LYRICS
STARTS WITH "H"

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Shortly after taking power, the Bolsheviks moved the Russian capital back to Moscow from this city')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: Shortly after taking power, the Bolsheviks moved the Russian capital back to Moscow from this city

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_2_5', 'clue_J_2_5_stuck', '(Ron: [pause] Oh, who is, um, Knucklehead Smith?)
(Alex: Knucklehead Smith? Did you create that name, Ron? [Laughter] Come on, fess up, you made it up didn\'t you?)
(Ron: Yeah.)
...
(Alex: [before giving the DJ! round categories] Even though you didn\'t realize it at the time your brain was working in the right direction a few moments ago when you gave Knucklehead Smith as one of your responses in the cartoon category. I\'ve just been informed that Knucklehead Smith was the number 2 doll of ventriloquist, Paul Winchell. His more famous one of course is Jerry Mahoney, so you were on the right track, Ron.)

Woody Woodpecker

Ron
')

Tom
Jeanne

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Ron
Tom
Jeanne

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Tom: I was writing Maryland.)
(Alex: Yeah, I thought that\'s what you might be going for, but unfortunately, there isn\'t enough showing there for us to decipher it.)
[After Ron\'s response Alex added that PA & DE were the Penn family and MD was the Calvert family.]
TomWhat is M [followed by short squiggle]
$3,600
RonWhat is Pennsylvania?
$4,300
JeanneWhat is Georgia?
$3,500
(1 of) Pennsylvania, Delaware or Maryland')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '1 of 3 colonies which as late as 1775 was still controlled by a proprietary family')

tr.td: COLONIAL AMERICA
1 of 3 colonies which as late as 1775 was still controlled by a proprietary family
Ron
Tom
Jeanne
3-day champion: $36,700
3rd place: Maytag washer & dryer + Jeopardy! box game
2nd place: Oak dining furniture by Keller & Villeroy & Bochi dishes + Jeopardy! box game
Ron
Tom
Jeanne

24 R,
5 W
(including 2 DDs)

12 R,
4 W
(including 1 DD)

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
